dialogue.htmlContent: As you walk down the street, you notice a poster plastered to a nearby building. Although it is evident someone put a lot of effort into it, it nonetheless comes across as crude. In bold letters, it proclaims:
You don't want to confront the mob right now, but you decide to rip the poster off and toss it into the nearest rubbish bin. Next time, you tell yourself.

You descend the steps into the building's cellar, following the sound of voices. It is surprisingly well lit and spacious inside. Unmarked crates and barrels line the walls, providing most of the seating, but there are a handful of chairs upon which you see some familiar faces. One of these is the long-winded donkey-boy who takes notice of you the instant you enter the room.

[test.speechMasculine(You!)] he exclaims, his face twisted in disgust as he extends an accusatory digit, #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_dsg_elis_eisek_introduced_as_dragon) && pc.getRace().equals(RACE_dsg_dragon)) [test.speechMasculine(Come to settle the score? You may have the rest of the town fooled, but we know all about your kind! What they did for generations to us common folk before they fell from favour.)] #ELSEIF(!flags.hasFlag(FLAG_dsg_elis_eisek_introduced_as_dragon) && pc.getRace().equals(RACE_dsg_dragon)) #IF(!game.isSillyMode()) [test.speechMasculine(It's not enough that that [eisek.race] has to pollute our market with his presence but now our inaction has led to an invasion.)] #ELSE [test.speechMasculine(It's not enough that one dragon pollutes our city with his presence but now... We should have acted! They're already here!)] #ENDIF #ELSEIF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_dsg_elis_eisek_introduced_as_dragon) && !pc.getRace().equals(RACE_dsg_dragon)) [test.speechMasculine(You can't fool us by wearing the guise of decent folk! We know who you really are.)] #ELSE [test.speechMasculine(Come to settle the score? You don't know anything about that [eisek.race] and what his kind are really like, what they did for generations to us common folk before they fell from favour.)] #ENDIF

You tell the donkey-boy, who you assume to be a leader of sorts, that you want them to leave Eisek alone. Your request is met by derisive laughter.

[test.speechMasculine(And why would we do that? We will not stand by while our homes are in danger!)]

What will do you to convince the mob?

#IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_SHY)) With your superior physique providing a much needed confidence boost, you #ELSE You #ENDIF #IF(pc.isFeral()) bare your teeth #ELSEIF(pc.getRace() == RACE_SLIME) increase your bulk by ingesting air #ELSE crack your knuckles #ENDIF menacingly and explain that if they don't honour your request, the next time you see them anywhere near Eisek you'll give them a thrashing they'll never forget. And with their history with the Enforcers, somehow you don't think you're going to be the one getting arrested.

A tough looking [npc.race] steps forward at your threat. [npc.speech(Think you're hot shit, huh? You don't scare me!)] [npc.she] says as [npc.she] charges forward!

#IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_SHY)) With your superior arcane ability providing a much needed confidence boost, you #ELSE You #ENDIF #IF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_FIREBALL)) cast a ball of fire that flies right between the donkey-boy's legs and scorches the floor beneath his chair. #ELSEIF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_SLAM)) #IF(game.isSillyMode()) punch the ground with a cry of [pc.speech(C'mon and slam!)], causing #ELSE use your telekinesis to cause #ENDIF a small earthquake in the cellar. Dust rains down from the ceiling. #ELSEIF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_TELEKENETIC_SHOWER)) lift a few small pebbles and make them orbit around the donkey-boy's head. #ELSEIF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_POISON_VAPOURS)) summon a few wisps of a poisonous vapour and swirl them around the room. #ELSEIF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_ICE_SHARD)) cast a shard of ice that flies right between the donkey-boy's legs and freezes a patch of floor beneath his chair. #ELSEIF(pc.hasSpell(SPELL_ARCANE_CHAIN_LIGHTNING) || pc.hasSpell(SPELL_ARCANE_LIGHTNING_SUPERBOLT)) send a thin bolt of arcane lightning right between the donkey-boy's legs that scorches the floor beneath his chair. #ELSE make your aura glow menacingly in a show of arcane prowess. #ENDIF You explain that if your request isn't honoured, the next time you see any of them anywhere near Eisek you won't miss. And with their history with the Enforcers, somehow you don't think you're going to be the one getting arrested.

A tough looking [npc.race] steps forward at your threat. [npc.speech(Think you're hot shit, huh? Your magic tricks don't scare me!)] [npc.she] says as [npc.she] charges forward.

As you stand triumphant above the crumpled form of [dsg_muscle.name], a murmur travels around the room. Your victory over what was apparently the mob's muscle seems to have had quite the effect and the donkey-boy for his part is visibly intimidated. [test.speechMasculine(V-very well. But I hope you understand that you've doomed this town and everyone in it!)]

Satisfied, you turn around to leave without another word. Somehow you doubt that the donkey-boy's prophecy of doom will come to pass.

[dsg_muscle.NamePos] finishing blow sends stars across your vision and you collapse in a heap on the cellar floor.

When you awake, you're alone in the cellar. Picking yourself up, you gingerly make your way back out into the street. You'd better tell Eisek the bad news...

#IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_SHY)) Trying your best to put on a brave face, you #ELSE You #ENDIF explain that if they don't honour your request, the next time you see them anywhere near Eisek they'll be sorry.

More derisive laughter meets your threat. [test.speechFeminine(We'll be sorry?)] says a tough-looking horse-girl as she walks up to you, [test.speechFeminine(No, I think you'll be sorry.)]

She grabs hold of you and starts shoving you towards the exit. Despite your struggling and protestations, you cannot overpower her iron grip before you find yourself back out on the street, slightly worse for wear.

You'd better tell Eisek the bad news...

#IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_SHY)) The conviction that you have the truth on your side provides a much needed confidence boost. #ELSEIF (pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_CONFIDENT)) You confidently walk into the middle of the cellar as if you were lecturing a bunch of schoolyard bullies rather than metaphorical den of vipers. #ENDIF You explain that the mob's fears are baseless. Eisek isn't anything like his ancestors. If he really was going to burn and pillage the place, running a stall in the market is an awfully strange way to go about it. #IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_SELFISH)) In fact, it's totally wrong. Even if he was just casing the town, there are easier and cheaper ways to do it. #ENDIF They have talked so much about what his kind is like and yet not one of them has tried to get to know him and find out what if that was true or not. You have. #IF(pc.hasPersonalityTrait(PERSONALITY_TRAIT_CYNICAL)) And you're not even the trusting sort. #ENDIF The Eisek you know is a humble produce farmer who took a big gamble in coming down from the mountains. If any member of this twisted little group had actually taken the time as you did, they would have found out the same thing.

The room is as silent as a tomb in response to your impassioned speech. After what seems like an eternity, the donkey-boy speaks again, [test.speechMasculine(Alright, you've made your point. Perhaps... we have been too quick to judge. Let us verify these claims.)]

Confident that they will come to the same conclusion as you have, you thank the townsfolk and turn around to leave without another word.

You channel your aura into your mastery of lust magic, letting fly with every spell you know until the room practically reeks of arousal. Unable to resist your power, the townsfolk immediately begin tearing at each other's clothing with glazed eyes and soaked crotches. The room is soon filled with an orchestra of moans as they use each other to sate the burning lust you've called forth and they haven't even shut the cellar door. Do you use this opportunity to join in or wait until they are finished and perhaps more suggestible?

You shakily stand up, soaked through with the fluids of the past two hours but more conscious than everyone else. You promise the pile of limp bodies beneath you that if they leave Eisek alone, there's more where that came from. A groggy sea of vaguely affirmative noises replies to your offer. Of course, you don't intend to actually follow through. More likely when the spells wear off, this motley little crew will realise that nobody shut the cellar door during their magic-fueled orgy. They've just given every passerby a free show and will probably disband out of sheer embarrassment.
